description: A tribute to Soviet Armenian experimental filmmaker and artist Sergei Parajanov, featuring 1,400 exhibits including installations, collages, assemblages, drawings, dolls, and hats. Located in the picturesque Dzoragyugh ethnographic center, the museum showcases Parajanov's creative genius and unconventional artistic vision.
highlights: Over 600 artworks including prison art created during imprisonment
Unpublished screenplays and librettos from visionary filmmaker
Famous for 1969 film 'Sayat Nova' (The Colour of Pomegranates)
Eccentric and engaging collection of collages, photographs, and assemblages
Prison-made aluminium coins now serve as Golden Apricot Film Festival prize
tips: Allow 1-2 hours to appreciate the eccentric collection
Museum has organized exhibitions in Cannes, Athens, Tokyo, Rome, Hollywood
Perfect for art lovers and cinema enthusiasts
Chosen by Parajanov himself before his death in 1990
One of Yerevan's most popular and culturally significant museums
vibe: Surreal, eccentric, and deeply personal - a window into the creative mind of a visionary artist who transformed suffering into extraordinary beauty
